content:
Define a 64-bit register to hold the value of the shift register. This register should be updated on the positive edge of the clock. If the load signal is high, the register should be loaded with the input data. Otherwise, it should hold its previous state or the shifted value based on the enable signal.

Retrieved Related Information:
- clk: Clock signal. (Type:Signal)
- load: Loads shift register with data[63:0] instead of shifting. Active high. (Type:Signal)
- ena: Chooses whether to shift. Active high. (Type:Signal)
- data: 64-bit input data. (Type:Signal)
- q: The contents of the shifter, 64 bits output. (Type:Signal)
- If load is high, load data into q. (Type:StateTransition)
- If ena is high and load is low, shift q based on the value of amount. (Type:StateTransition)
- If ena is low, q retains its value. (Type:StateTransition)

```
Implement the logic to shift the register left by 1 bit when the enable signal is high and the amount is set to 2'b00. This involves taking the current value of the register, shifting it left by one position, and updating the register with this new value.

If ena is high and load is low, shift q based on the value of amount. (Type:StateTransition)
```
